intro: Stenostephanus anderssonii, commonly known as the Andes mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features compact, evergreen foliage with small, leathery leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom during the cooler months. Stenostephanus anderssonii is well adapted to harsh, alpine environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
